alert.note: Alert for Alfalfa; Garfield; Grant; Kay; Noble (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 10 at 11:57PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Kay, northern Noble, southeastern Alfalfa, southern Grant and northern Garfield Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1157 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Jet to near Hillsdale to near Billings to near Marland to 7 miles southeast of Ponca City. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ponca City, Tonkawa, Pond Creek, Billings, Lamont, Kaw City, Red Rock, Kremlin, Goltry, Marland, Nash, Hunter, Hillsdale, Carrier, Jefferson, southwestern Kaw Lake, Sooner Lake and Ceres. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 198 and 220. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
